client

Class ClientGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • client.ClientGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class ClientGUI
extends javafx.application.Application
implements java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    The ClientGUI opens a login screen and prompts the user for a user name and ip address to connect to a game. If the player is the first person to connect to the game, they are redirected to a waiting screen. If they are the second person to connect, both players will be directed to the game screen.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Casey, Karman

      • propertyChange

        public void propertyChange(java.beans.PropertyChangeEvent evt)
        Whenever a player triggers an event that the other player needs to see, this method is called. Depending on what is sent or triggered, an action will occur on the other players screen.
        Specified by:
        propertyChange in interface java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
        Parameters:
        evt - PropertyChangeEvent object

        private void determineWinner(java.lang.String player1Pick,
                             java.lang.String player2Pick)
                      throws java.io.IOException
